page.title: 14BURNTHOUSE LANE ESTATE
page.content: My friends and I go to Bradley Rowe Middle School on this large housing estate.When Councillor Mrs Johns moved into her home in 1928 there were only a few houses.There were no pavements or street lights.Gradually the estate grew and our school was opened in 1931 The original street lights were gas and lit by a man each evening.Now they are electric and switched on automatically. Mrs Johns left school at 14 but we leave at 16.She earned 8 shillings (40p) a week and walked to work because she could not afford to catch the bus in both directions.Mr Daw left school at 16 in 1921 and worked in his father's bakery for 10 shillings(50p) a week.On Sundays people brought their roast dinners to be baked in the coal fired ovens,paying a penny(0.4p) each. Now each home has its own cooker
